intro: Matelea kirkbridei, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators like moths. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, while the stems are woody and branched. Matelea kirkbridei is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments.
